nodes.bodyText:
Not feeling strongly, but the name DirectoryContext, doesn't tell me that its for ListingDirectories.
Actually in future, I would like to see a generic context being used for all kinds of caching. With this change we would have got two contexts representing different caching information.

nodes.bodyText:
I agree that consolidating to one context used for all kinds of caching is ideal. But there is also nuances between coordinator cache and worker cache, for whom we probably would still want some differentiation.
Currently the cacheable flag in HiveFileContext is determined by the node selection strategy, which is valid because file cache is on the workers, so it makes little sense to cache when there is no affinity. It does not feel natural to apply the same logic for listFiles, because it is coordinator-only caching, which means it is always hard affinity :P.
Let me keep it as is to be consistent with HiveFileContext. We could revisit when we try to consolidate cache context :)
